subject: AI
title: Feature Engineering
description: Turning raw data into signals the model can actually use.

hook.text: You're predicting taxi ride duration. You have pickup time as a Unix timestamp. The model ignores it. But 'is it rush hour?' is gold.

buildup.text: Feature engineering is creating new input columns from raw data â€” extracting the hour from a timestamp, computing distance from coordinates, encoding text as numbers.

discovery.text: A well-crafted feature can do more for accuracy than switching to a fancier model. Domain knowledge is your biggest advantage here.

twist.text: Deep learning reduced the need for manual features in some domains (images, text), but tabular data still benefits enormously from thoughtful engineering.

climax.text: Start with simple features, measure impact, iterate. The best features are the ones that capture causality, not just correlation.

punchline.text: Models see numbers. Feature engineering translates your domain insight into numbers the model can exploit.

quiz.question: What is feature engineering?
options: Selecting which model architecture to use
Creating informative input variables from raw data
Training the model for more epochs
